map.name: default
map.item:
In this experiment, we are interested in how well you can remember a sequence of numbers.
In each trial, you will hear a sequence of digits read aloud, one at a time. Your goal is to remember the digits in the order they were presented. After the last digit is presented, you will see a prompt on screen to recall the numbers you heard. When that prompt appears, use the keyboard to type in the numbers, in the order in which they appeared. You do not need to include spaces or any other characters between the numbers. You may use the backspace key to delete numbers if you make a mistake. If you are unsure about the sequence, make your best guess.
Once you have completed entering all the numbers for that sequence, press Enter to move on. The next sequence of numbers will be presented shortly.
Press Enter to begin when you are ready.

In this experiment, we are interested in how well you can remember a sequence of numbers that is presented to you.
In each trial, you will hear a sequence of digits read aloud, one at a time. Your goal is to remember the digits in the REVERSE order they were presented. In other words, if you hear the sequence "1,2,3", you should recall "3,2,1".
When the last digit is presented, you will see a prompt on screen to recall the numbers you heard. When that prompt appears, use the keyboard to type in the numbers, in the opposite order which they appeared - start with the last number that was presented. You do not need to include spaces or any other characters between the numbers. You may use the backspace key to delete numbers if you made a mistake. If you are unsure about the sequence, make your best guess.
Once you have completed entering all the numbers for that sequence, press Enter to move on. The next sequence of numbers will be presented shortly.
Press Enter to begin when you are ready.
